TopicTitle: New SAS Primary Direction Control Buggy?

Articles.Content:
Is it just me, or is the new SAS wonky...

If you click any of the directions (prograde, retrograde etc...) the SAS moves close to it, but never actually points dead center (perpetually about 25 degrees off). This even happens in sandbox mode. Is this a bug, or "intentional"... what use is SAS if it wont point where it should?

I can confirm the new "hold marker" commands are a little buggy. They do work most of the time, but at least for some rockets I've built they are way off. I don't have useful logs/ships to hand though. Somewhat related: these commands also hog far too much electric charge, even compared to regular SAS (up to 50x in some cases)
Hmmmm, haven't had this issue. Installed mods?

I currently have Kerbal Engineer, StageRecovery and Kerbal Alarm Clock, however I encountered the problem before those mods were updated to 0.90; this is a stock issue. Incidentally I haven't experienced the bug since installing the mods, but that's probably just luck.
Tis a stock issue, you see it really easily on small craft, or the other thing people notice is if the ship has a lot of torque. I believe its already in the bugtracker
